analysis.summary: Vue page component that renders a two-tab interface for viewing all notifications and managing notification preferences. It displays the unread notification count and switches between a notifications list view and a preferences view based on the active tab.
analysis.purpose: Serve as the main notifications page in the application, allowing users to view their notifications and update their notification settings.

components.name: NotificationsList
components.responsibility: Fetches and displays the list of all user notifications.

components.name: NotificationPreferences
components.responsibility: Renders and manages the userâ€™s notification settings and preferences.

analysis.usage: Typically registered as the component for the '/notifications' route in the application router. Other parts of the app navigate to this page or link to it, optionally with a query parameter '?tab=preferences' to open the settings tab by default.
notes: Uses the Composition API (script setup) with reactive ref for activeTab.
Initial tab selection comes from the route query parameter 'tab'.
Unread notification count is injected via a shared 'useNotifications' provider.
Scoped styles define tab layout and active-tab indicator.
No additional methods or computed properties beyond simple reactive state.
